title: Improve Event to Command Binding in WPF
body: Invoking a command on an event requires the use of the Expression Blend interaction triggers. The syntax for this is pretty ugly.

comments.body: I have been missing this functionality for years. So thumbs up on this one.
I agree with Theodore: bind to methods instead of commands. Also support event parameters. Like
I like Theodore's suggestion since command bindings require code to handle disabling when the command is disabled, and would lead to a lot of bloat in the standard controls.
Allow binding events directly to methods instead of via commands
